Governing_Law: Gender Guidelines for sexual assault claims
Evidence_Assessment: Medical reports, witness testimony considered; minor discrepancies (spelling errors, document routing) overemphasized
Decision_Outcome: RPD rejected refugee claim based on credibility concerns
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish credible basis for refugee claim
Credibility_Factor: Inconsistencies in documentation, lack of application of Gender Guidelines
Legal_Rule: Credibility findings must be based on reasoned analysis, considering context and avoiding microscopic scrutiny
Procedural_Issue: Failure to apply Gender Guidelines, inadequate reasoning
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution due to being a widowed woman in Kenya with associated vulnerabilities
Outcome_on_Merits: Not determined â€“ original decision set aside
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Unfair due to lack of contextual analysis and disregard of key evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Medical reports, witness testimony, submitted documents with minor discrepancies
Legal_Framework: Canadian refugee determination framework, IRPA, Charter considerations
Applicant_Challenge: Credibility assessment undermined by flawed reasoning
Court_Result: Judicial intervention warranted, case remitted to new panel
Defendant_Response: RPD maintained rejection based on perceived inconsistencies
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, testimonial evidence, medical evidence
Remedy_Requested: Quashing of RPD decision, reassessment by new panel
Legal_Provision: Section 96 of IRPA (jurisdiction of Federal Court), Article 1A(2) of Refugee Convention
Governing_Rule: Rule requiring reasoned credibility analysis respecting gender-sensitive standards
